info: To perform a narrow squat, stand with your feet 6-8 inches apart, toes pointing slightly outward. Keeping your back straight and chest up, slowly lower your body down into a squat, keeping your weight in your heels. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

To perform a sumo squat stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing outward at a 45-degree angle. Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, slowly lower your body down into a squat, keeping your weight in your heels. Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then slowly stand up to the starting position.

To perform a reverse lunge stand with your feet hip-width apart, with your hands by your sides. Take a large step backward with one foot, keeping your back straight and your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle. Lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your back knee almost touching the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing, bringing your back foot forward to meet your front foot. Repeat with the other leg.

To perform a forward lunge stand with your feet hip-width apart, with your hands by your sides or on your hips. Take a large step forward with one foot, keeping your back straight and your front knee behind your toes. Lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your back knee almost touching the ground and your front thigh parallel to the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing, bringing your back foot forward to meet your front foot. Repeat with the other leg.

instruction: To perform a situp to crunch start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head or cross your arms over your chest. Lift your torso up towards your knees, curling up and lifting your shoulders off the ground. Hold the position for a brief moment. Slowly lower your torso back down to the starting position. At your next lift, repeat the same movement but with a shorter crunch with your abdominal muscles. Slowly lower back down and repeat, alternating between situp and crunch movements.

info: To perform a pulse sit-up, start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest, and lift your torso up towards your knees. As you reach the top of the movement, pause for a brief moment and contract your abdominal muscles, then start pulsing for as many counts possible. Slowly lower back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

To perform a tricep pushup, start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Your hands should be positioned directly under your shoulders, with your fingers facing forward or slightly inward. Lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground, then push back up to the starting position. Focus on extending your arm and locking out your elbow to engage your triceps.

To perform a wide pushup, start in a plank position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart. Engage your core muscles and maintain a straight line from head to heels. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground. Push back up to the starting position.

To perform a romanian deadlift, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed straight ahead or slightly outward. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. Reach down and grasp a weight or barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart, keeping your arms straight. Lift the weight up to a point where your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back is parallel to the ground. Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

To perform a staggered romanian deadlift, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with one foot slightly in front of the other (staggered stance). Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. Hold a weight or barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing your body. Lower the weight down towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged, until your hands are just above the ground. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, squeezing your glutes and pushing your hips back.

To perform a bent over row, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight or barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing towards your body. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. Let your arms hang straight down from your shoulders, with your elbows close to your body. Slowly lift the weight or barbell up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and your back straight. Hold the weight or barbell at your chest for a brief moment, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

To perform a renegade row, start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing towards your body. Rotate your body to the right, keeping your arms straight, and lift the dumbbell in your right hand off the ground. As you lift the dumbbell, bend your elbow and pull the weight towards your right side, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position and repeat the motion on the left side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

To perform a chest press, lie on the ground or a flat bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground. Grip the barbell or dumbbells with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the weight to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body. Pause for a moment, then press the weight upwards, extending your arms fully. Lower the weight back down to the starting position and repeat.

To perform a shoulder press, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight or resistance at shoulder height with your palms facing forward. Slowly lift the weight overhead, extending your arms fully and keeping your elbows close to your ears. Hold the weight at the top of the movement for a brief moment. Lower the weight back down to the starting position, squeezing your shoulder blades together and keeping control throughout the entire range of motion.

To perform a jumping jack, stand with your feet together, with your hands by your sides. Jump your feet out to the sides, while raising your arms above your head. Quickly return your feet to the starting position, while lowering your arms back down to your sides. Repeat steps 2-3 for the desired number of repetitions.

To perform mountain climbers, start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Bring one knee up towards your chest, keeping your foot flexed. Quickly switch and bring the other knee up towards your chest, mimicking the motion of running. Continue alternating legs as quickly as possible, aiming for 30-60 seconds or more.
